title: "What is the significance of the drum's rhythm in inducing ecstasy and contact with supernatural forces?"
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discusses the magical qualities of drum rhythms and their ability to induce a state of ecstasy and contact with supernatural forces. In this last part, the author describes how the ancient god Quetzalcoatl manifests himself during one of these drumming rituals, inspiring people to chant magical formulas and mantras. Quetzalcoatl declares his nature as "the living Quetzalcoatl," and describes his connection to the sky, earth, and all living beings. He also asserts his identity as the feathered serpent, saying that he will not be present among his people until his serpent has coiled in their bellies.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the return of Quetzalcoatl signifies the restoration of the original deity in the Mexican soul, freeing it from foreign influence. The deity brings solace and relief to the people, but also a warning that once gone, there may be no turning back. The spiritual journey is a continuous cycle of renewal and growth, guided by the serpent piumato's wisdom and power.
